content.text:
# Timeline of the 2025 Atlantic hurricane season

The 2025 Atlantic hurricane season is the current cycle of the annual tropical cyclone season in the Atlantic Ocean in the Northern Hemisphere. The season officially began on June 1, and will end on November 30. These dates, adopted by convention, historically describe the period in each year when most subtropical or tropical cyclogenesis occurs in the Atlantic Ocean (over 97%). No subtropical or tropical development occurred in the Atlantic prior to the start of the season, and the season got off to the slowest start since 2014. Even so, hurricane researchers are predicting an above-normal number of named storms this year.|group="nb"}}
This timeline documents tropical cyclone formations, strengthening, weakening, landfalls, extratropical transitions, and dissipations during the season. It includes information that was not released throughout the season, meaning that data from post-storm reviews by the National Hurricane Center, such as a storm that was not initially warned upon, has been included.
By convention, meteorologists use one time zone when issuing forecasts and making observations: Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), and also use the 24-hour clock (where 00:00 = midnight UTC). The National Hurricane Center uses both UTC and the time zone where the center of the tropical cyclone is currently located. The time zones utilized (east to west) are: Greenwich, Cape Verde, Atlantic, Eastern, and Central. In this timeline, all information is listed by UTC first, with the respective regional time zone included in parentheses. Additionally, figures for maximum sustained winds and position estimates are rounded to the nearest 5 units (knots, miles, or kilometers), following National Hurricane Center practice. Direct wind observations are rounded to the nearest whole number. Atmospheric pressures are listed to the nearest millibar and nearest hundredth of an inch of mercury.
Timeline of events
June
June 1
* The 2025 Atlantic hurricane season officially begins.
June 23
* 06:00 UTC (2:00 a.m. AST) at A tropical depression forms from a non-tropical low-pressure area about  east of Bermuda.
* 12:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. AST) at The tropical depression strengthens into Tropical Storm Andrea about  east of Bermuda, and simultaneously reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of  and a minimum central pressure of .
June 24
* 18:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Andrea degenerates into a remnant low about  east-northeast of Bermuda, and later dissipates.
June 28
* 18:00 UTC (1:00 p.m. CDT) at Tropical Depression Two forms from the northern portion of a tropical wave about  east of Veracruz, Veracruz.
June 29
* 12:00 UTC (7:00 a.m. CDT) at Tropical Depression Two strengthens into Tropical Storm Barry.
* 18:00 UTC (1:00 p.m. CDT) at Tropical Storm Barry attains its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of  and minimum central pressure .
June 30
* 02:00 UTC (9:00 p.m. CDT, June 29) at Tropical Storm Barry weakens into a tropical depression as it makes landfall in Veracruz, about  south-southeast of Tampico, Tamaulipas, with maximum sustained winds of , and later dissipates over the mountainous terrain of eastern Mexico.
July
July 4
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. EDT) at Tropical Depression Three forms about 150 mi (240 km) south-southeast of Charleston, South Carolina.
July 5
* 12:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. EDT) at Tropical Depression Three strengthens into Tropical Storm Chantal about 150 mi (240 km) south-southeast of Charleston.
July 6
* 06:00 UTC (2:00 a.m. EDT) at Tropical Storm Chantal reaches its peak intensity with maximum sustained winds of  and a minimum central pressure of  about 75 mi (115 km) east-northeast of Charleston.
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. EDT) at Tropical Storm Chantal makes landfall in far eastern South Carolina with sustained winds of  about 70 mi (115 km) northeast of Charleston.
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. EDT) at Tropical Storm Chantal weakens into a tropical depression inland about 20 mi (30 km) southwest of Lumberton, North Carolina.
July 7
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. EDT) at Tropical Depression Chantal transitions to a post-tropical cyclone inland about 30 mi (50 km) north-northeast of Newport News, Virginia.
August
August 3
* 18:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Dexter forms from a non-tropical low about  west-northwest of Bermuda.
August 6
* 12:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Dexter attains its peak intensity as a tropical cyclone, with maximum sustained winds of  and a minimum central pressure of .
August 7
* 00:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. AST, August 6) at Tropical Storm Dexter becomes extratropical, and subsequently dissipates, after briefly strengthening into a hurricane-force extratropical cyclone southeast of St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador on the morning of August 8.
August 11
* 15:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. CVT) at Tropical Storm Erin forms about 280 mi (455 km) west-northwest of the Cape Verde islands.
August 15
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Erin strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane about 460 mi (740 km) east of the northern Leeward Islands, making it the first hurricane of the season.
August 16
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. AST, August 15) at Hurricane Erin strengthens to Category 2 intensity about 250 mi (405 km) east-northeast of Anguilla.
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Erin strengthens to Category 3 intensity about 170 mi (275 km) northeast of Anguilla, making it the first major hurricane of the season.
* 09:50 UTC (5:50 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Erin strengthens to Category 4 intensity about 150 mi (240 km) northeast of Anguilla.
* 15:20 UTC (11:20 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Erin strengthens to Category 5 intensity about 105 mi (170 km) north of Anguilla.
* 18:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. AST) at Hurricane Erin reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of  and a minimum central pressure of , about 110 mi (180 km) north of Anguilla.
August 17
* 00:00 UTC (8:00 p.m. AST, August 16) at Hurricane Erin weakens to Category 4 intensity about 150 mi (235 km) northeast of San Juan, Puerto Rico.
* 06:00 UTC (2:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Erin weakens to Category 3 intensity about 140 mi (220 km) north of San Juan.
August 18
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. AST, August 17) at Hurricane Erin regains Category 4 intensity about 130 mi (205 km) east-northeast of Grand Turk Island.
August 19
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. EDT, August 18) at Hurricane Erin weakens back to Category 3 intensity about 690 mi (1,105 km) southwest of Bermuda.
* 12:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. EDT) at Hurricane Erin weakens to Category 2 intensity about 665 mi (1,070 km) southwest of Bermuda.
August 22
* 06:00 UTC (2:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Erin weakens to Category 1 intensity about 400 mi (645 km) north-northeast of Bermuda.
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Hurricane Erin transitions into an extratropical cyclone about 375 mi (605 km) south-southeast of Halifax, Nova Scotia.
August 23
* 18:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Fernand forms from the northern portion of a tropical wave about  south-southeast of Bermuda.
August 25
* 12:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Fernand attains its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of  and a minimum central pressure of .
August 27
* 18:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Fernand transitions into a post-tropical cyclone, and subsequently dissipates.
September
September 17
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Depression Seven forms about 1,185 mi (1,905 m) east-southeast of the northern Leeward Islands.
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Depression Seven strengthens into Tropical Storm Gabrielle about 1,085 mi (1,745 km) east of the northern Leeward Islands.
September 21
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Gabrielle strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane about 320 mi (515 km) southeast of Bermuda.
September 22
* 13:00 UTC (9:00 a.m. AST) at Gabrielle rapidly intensifies into a Category 3 hurricane about 195 mi (310 km) southeast of Bermuda.
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Gabrielle intensifies into a Category 4 hurricane, and reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of  and a minimum central pressure of , about 180 mi (290 km) east-southeast of Bermuda.
September 24
* 00:00 UTC (8:00 p.m. AST, September 23) at Hurricane Gabrielle weakens into a Category 3 hurricane about 580 mi (930 km) east-northeast of Bermuda.
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Gabrielle weakens into a Category 2 hurricane about 1,200 mi (1,935 km) west of the Azores.
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Humberto forms about 550 mi (885 km) east-northeast of the northern Leeward Islands.
September 25
* 03:00 UTC (3:00 a.m. GMT) at Hurricane Gabrielle weakens into a Category 1 hurricane about 855 mi (1,375 km) west of the Azores.
* 21:00 UTC (9:00 p.m. GMT) at Hurricane Gabrielle transitions into a post-tropical cyclone about 265 mi (425 km) west-southwest of the Azores.
September 26
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Humberto strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane about 465 mi (750 km) of the northern Leeward Islands.
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Hurricane Humberto rapidly intensifies into a Category 3 hurricane about 430 mi (690 km) northeast of the northern Leeward Islands.
September 27
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. AST, September 26) at Hurricane Humberto intensifies into a Category 4 hurricane about 390 mi (630 km) northeast of the northern Leeward Islands.
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. EDT) at Tropical Depression Nine forms about 180 mi (290 km) of the eastern tip of Cuba|group="nb"}}
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Hurricane Humberto intensifies into a Category 5 hurricane about 350 mi (560 km) north-northeast of the northern Leeward Islands and about 685 mi (1,105 km) south-southeast of Bermuda.
September 28
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. AST, September 27) at Hurricane Humberto reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of 160 mph (260 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 924 mbar (27.29 inHg) about 365 mi (585 km) north of the northern Leeward Islands and about 635 mi (1,025 km) south-southeast of Bermuda.
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Humberto weakens into a Category 4 hurricane about 585 mi (945 km) south of Bermuda.
* 18:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. EDT) at Tropical Depression Nine strengthens into Tropical Storm Imelda about 95 mi (155 km) west-northwest of the central Bahamas and about 370 mi (600 km) southeast of Cape Canaveral, Florida.
September 30
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. AST, September 29) at Hurricane Humberto weakens into a Category 3 hurricane about 265 mi (430 km) southwest of Bermuda.
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Humberto weakens into a Category 2 hurricane about 275 mi (440 km) west of Bermuda.
* 12:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. EDT) at Tropical Storm Imelda strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane about 180 mi (290 km) of Great Abaco Island.
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Humberto weakens into a Category 1 hurricane about 300 mi (485 km) west of Bermuda.
October
October 1
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Humberto degenerates into a remnant low about 340 mi (550 km) north-northeast of Bermuda.
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. EDT) at Hurricane Imelda strengthens into a Category 2 hurricane and simultaneously reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of 100 mph (155 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 966 mbar (28.53 inHg), about 340 mi (550 km) west-southwest of Bermuda.
October 2
* 06:00 UTC (2:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Imelda weakens into a Category 1 hurricane about 80 mi (125 km) east-northeast of Bermuda.
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Imelda transitions into an extratropical cyclone about 315 mi (505 km) east-northeast of Bermuda.
October 7
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Jerry forms about 1,315 mi (2,120 km) east-southeast of the northern Leeward Islands.
October 9
* 00:00 UTC (8:00 p.m. AST, October 8) at Tropical Storm Jerry reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of 65 mph (105 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 999 mbar (29.50 inHg), about 560 mi (900 km) east-southeast of the northern Leeward Islands.
October 10
* 03:00 UTC (3:00 a.m. GMT) at Subtropical Storm Karen forms and simultaneously reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of 45 mph (75 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 998 mbar (29.47 inHg), about 545 mi (880 km) north-northwest of the Azores.
* 21:00 UTC (9:00 p.m. GMT) at Subtropical Storm Karen transitions into a post-tropical cyclone about 675 mi (1,085 km) north-northwest of the Azores.
October 11
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Jerry degenerates into a trough about 330 mi (535 km) south-southeast of Bermuda.
October 13
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Lorenzo forms about 1,095 mi (1,760 km) west of Cabo Verde.
October 14
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. AST, October 13) at Tropical Storm Lorenzo reaches its peak intensity, with maximum sustained winds of 60 mph (95 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 999 mbar (29.5 inHg), about 1,245 mi (2,005 km) west of Cabo Verde.
October 15
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Lorenzo degenerates into a remnant low about 1,300 mi (2,090 km) west-northwest of Cabo Verde.
October 21
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Tropical Storm Melissa forms about 300 mi (480 km) south of Port-au-Prince.
October 25
* 18:00 UTC (2:00 p.m. EDT) at Tropical Storm Melissa strengthens into a Category 1 hurricane about 145 mi (230 km) southeast of Kingston, Jamaica and about 235 mi (380 km) southwest of Port-au-Prince.
October 26
* 00:00 UTC (8:00 p.m. EDT, October 25) at Hurricane Melissa intensifies into a Category 2 hurricane about 130 mi (210 km) southeast of Kingston and about 260 mi (420 km) west-southwest of Port-au-Prince.
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. EDT, October 25) at Hurricane Melissa intensifies into a Category 3 hurricane about 125 mi (200 km) south-southeast of Kingston and about 280 mi (455 km) west-southwest of Port-au-Prince.
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa intensifies into a Category 4 hurricane about 120 mi (195 km) south-southeast of Kingston and about 280 mi (450 km) south-southwest of Guantánamo, Cuba.
October 27
* 09:00 UTC (5:00 a.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa intensifies into a Category 5 hurricane about 130 mi (205 km) south-southwest of Kingston and about 315 mi (505 km) south-southwest of Guantánamo.
October 28
* 14:00 UTC (10:00 a.m. EDT) at Melissa reaches its peak intensity with maximum sustained winds of 185 mph (295 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 892 mbar (26.34 inHg) about 45 mi (70 km) south-southeast of Negril, Jamaica and about 255 mi (410 km) southwest of Guantánamo.
* 17:00 UTC (1:00 p.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa makes landfall in southwestern Jamaica with sustained winds of 185 mph (295 km/h) about 25 mi (40 km) southeast of Negril and about 145 mi (235 km) south of Guantánamo.
* 20:00 UTC (4:00 p.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa weakens into a Category 4 hurricane inland about 10 mi (15 km) south of Montego Bay, Jamaica and about 215 mi (345 km) southwest of Guantánamo.
October 29
* 00:00 UTC (8:00 p.m. EDT, October 28) at Hurricane Melissa weakens into a Category 3 hurricane about 50 mi (80 km) east-northeast of Montego Bay and about 160 mi (260 km) southwest of Guantánamo.
* 03:00 UTC (11:00 p.m. EDT, October 28) at Hurricane Melissa reintensifies into a Category 4 hurricane about 110 mi (175 km) southwest of Guantánamo and about 300 mi (485 km) south of the central Bahamas.
* 06:00 UTC (2:00 a.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa weakens into a Category 3 hurricane about 80 mi (130 km) west-southwest of Guantánamo and about 270 mi (435 km) south of the central Bahamas.
* 07:10 UTC (3:10 a.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa makes landfall on the southern coast of eastern Cuba with sustained winds of 120 mph (195 km/h) about 20 mi (30 km) east of Chivirico, Cuba and about 60 mi (95 km) west-southwest of Guantánamo.
* 12:00 UTC (8:00 a.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa weakens into a Category 2 hurricane inland about 45 mi (70 km) northwest of Guantánamo and about 205 mi (335 km) south of the central Bahamas.
* 21:00 UTC (5:00 p.m. EDT) at Hurricane Melissa weakens into a Category 1 hurricane about 80 mi (130 km) southeast of the central Bahamas and about 890 mi (1,435 km) southwest of Bermuda.
October 31
* 15:00 UTC (11:00 a.m. AST) at Hurricane Melissa transitions into a post-tropical cyclone about 520 mi (840 km) north-northeast of Bermuda and about 650 mi (1,045 km) southwest of Cape Race.
November
November 30
* The 2025 Atlantic hurricane season officially ends.
See also
* Timeline of the 2025 Pacific hurricane season
* Tropical cyclones in 2025
* Lists of Atlantic hurricanes
Notes
References
External links
* [https://www.nhc.noaa.gov/archive/2025/ 2025 Tropical Cyclone Advisory Archive], National Hurricane Center
